field_reports.description:
At least, nine people died on Monday, August 11, 2025, on Cape Verdean island of Sao Vicente. , victims of  violent flood caused by heavy rains. The goverment declared a state of emergency on the island. 

The heavy rain that fell during the early hours of today also damage to homes, public roads and vehicles. 
The Cape Verde Red Cross immediately activated its emergency protocol and rapi assessment are underway.
field_reports.summary: CPV: Flood - 08-2025 - FLASH FLOOD SAO VICENTE

field_reports.description:
According to the storm warning of Kyrgyzhydromet under the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Kyrgyz Republic, in the period from July 28 to 31, 2025 in the regions of the country were expected floods caused by heavy rains, so on July 30, 2025 at about 23:00 in the village of Tamchy Toru-Aigyr-Tamchy village of Toru-Aigyr-Tamchy aiyl aimak of Issyk-Kul district, as a result of heavy rains there were mudflows.

The neighboring village of Kosh-Kol also experienced intense precipitation leading to localized floods
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Pluvial/Flash Flood - 07-2025 - Issyk-Kul

results.name: KGZ: Pluvial/Flash Flood - 07-2025 - Issyk-Kul
results.summary:
According to the storm warning of Kyrgyzhydromet under the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Kyrgyz Republic, in the period from July 28 to 31, 2025 in the regions of the country were expected floods caused by heavy rains, so on July 30, 2025 at about 23:00 in the village of Tamchy Toru-Aigyr-Tamchy village of Toru-Aigyr-Tamchy aiyl aimak of Issyk-Kul district, as a result of heavy rains there were mudflows.

The neighboring village of Kosh-Kol also experienced intense precipitation leading to localized floods

field_reports.description:
General Information:

On April 14, 2025, between 17:00 and 20:30, a mudflow occurred in Ak-Taylak village, Ala-Buka district, Jalal-Abad region, as a result of heavy rainfall accompanied by hail. A total of 18.1 mm of precipitation fell within two hours — significantly higher than the monthly norm of 5–6 mm.

Damage Caused:

The mudflow damaged one residential house, destroyed one on-farm road bridge, and one pedestrian bridge. Alternative routes are available for both transport and pedestrians. The figures are preliminary and subject to change as the MoES continues its assessment
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Other - 04-2025 - Mudflow in Jalal-Abad

results.name: KGZ: Other - 04-2025 - Mudflow in Jalal-Abad
results.summary:
General Information:

On April 14, 2025, between 17:00 and 20:30, a mudflow occurred in Ak-Taylak village, Ala-Buka district, Jalal-Abad region, as a result of heavy rainfall accompanied by hail. A total of 18.1 mm of precipitation fell within two hours — significantly higher than the monthly norm of 5–6 mm.

Damage Caused:

The mudflow damaged one residential house, destroyed one on-farm road bridge, and one pedestrian bridge. Alternative routes are available for both transport and pedestrians. The figures are preliminary and subject to change as the MoES continues its assessment

field_reports.epi_notes_since_last_fr: Compared to the situation report that was uploaded on March 17, the number of children infected with measles has reached 4786 and the Republican Center for Immunoprophylaxis shared with us the data about one more fatality. At the moment, the Ministry of Health expresses the need for technical support in disseminating information on measles to the population through all sources and support of volunteers during the campaigns.
field_reports.description:
Information about measles cases from January 1 to March 25, 2025
The Republican Center for Immunoprophylaxis under the Ministry of Health of the Kyrgyz Republic informs that as of 25.03.2025 4786 suspected cases of measles and rubella were registered. Of these, 4372 cases were classified as measles, including: 589 cases laboratory confirmed, 1760 cases clinically confirmed and 2022 cases epidemiologically related. The intensive rate per 100,000 population is 57.6. 
By territorial breakdown of measles cases out of the total number of cases: Bishkek city - 2,728 cases (238.2), Osh city - 247 cases (68.4), Osh oblast - 331 cases (22.7), Batken oblast - 90 cases (15.8), Chui oblast - 587 cases (54.9), Jalal-Abad oblast - 87 cases (6.6), Issyk-Kul oblast - 76 cases (14.1), Naryn oblast - 100 cases (32.4), Talas oblast - 126 cases (46.1).
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Epidemic - 03-2025 - Measles outbreak #3 (2025-03-30)

field_reports.epi_notes_since_last_fr:
Last field report was on 13.03.2025, but today ministry of health representatives confirmed to the cabinet of ministers 8 deaths of children from measles and an increase in the cases of the disease  The Republican Immunoprophylaxis Center of the Ministry of Health of the Kyrgyz Republic informs, 
that as of 18.03.2025 4369 suspected cases of measles and rubella were registered cases of measles and rubella. Of these, 4055 cases were classified as measles, including: 570 cases laboratory confirmed, 1562 cases clinically confirmed and 1922 cases epidemiologically linked. 
The intensive rate per 100,000 population is 57.6.
field_reports.description: The healthcare system is under strain due to the rising number of cases, with hospitals and healthcare facilities experiencing an increased workload, particularly in affected regions. Medical staff, including doctors, nurses, and laboratory technicians, are overwhelmed with the diagnosis, treatment, and monitoring of measles cases. The outbreak has put pressure on vaccination programs, requiring swift and effective mobilization to contain the spread and prevent further cases, with efforts to vaccinate vulnerable populations being scaled up. The outbreak has had devastating impacts on children, particularly those who are unvaccinated or under-immunized. As of the latest report, 8 child deaths have been confirmed, which has further heightened public concern and fear around the disease.Public health messaging and education are key to managing the situation, with efforts focusing on reducing vaccine hesitancy and increasing awareness of the importance of vaccination, especially among communities with limited access to information.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Epidemic - 03-2025 - Measles outbreak #2 (2025-03-18)

field_reports.epi_notes_since_last_fr:
According to the analysis of data on measles from the Republican Centre for Immunoprophylaxis of the Ministry of Health of the Kyrgyz Republic, as of 10.03.2025, 4169 suspected cases of measles and rubella were registered.  Of these, 3,739 cases were classified as measles, including: 540 laboratory-confirmed cases, 1409 cases clinically confirmed and 1,790 cases epidemiologically linked. The intensive rate per 100,000 population is 53.1.
2 deaths of children have been recorded. 
By territorial distribution of measles cases out of the total number of cases:
Bishkek city - 2098 cases, Chui oblast - 475 cases, Osh city - 181 cases, Osh oblast - 257 cases, Naryn province - 75 cases, Talas oblast - 90 cases, Issyk-Kul province - 59 cases,  Batken oblast - 65 cases, Jalal-Abad oblast – 52 cases
field_reports.description: With 4169 suspected cases, including 3,739 measles cases, the healthcare system is likely experiencing significant strain. Hospitals, clinics, and health professionals are overwhelmed with the high number of patients, leading to longer waiting times, limited resources, and increased workload for medical staff. Intensive care units and pediatric wards are under pressure due to the severity of measles cases, particularly with the two recorded deaths.The need for more diagnostic services has increased, as 540 cases were laboratory-confirmed. The need for large-scale vaccination campaigns is critical to prevent further spread.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Epidemic - 03-2025 - Measles outbreak

results.name: KGZ: Epidemic - 03-2025 - Measles outbreak
results.summary: With 4169 suspected cases, including 3,739 measles cases, the healthcare system is likely experiencing significant strain. Hospitals, clinics, and health professionals are overwhelmed with the high number of patients, leading to longer waiting times, limited resources, and increased workload for medical staff. Intensive care units and pediatric wards are under pressure due to the severity of measles cases, particularly with the two recorded deaths.The need for more diagnostic services has increased, as 540 cases were laboratory-confirmed. This likely puts pressure on testing facilities, requiring faster turnaround times for results to guide treatment and containment efforts.Given that measles is a preventable disease, a shortage or delay in vaccine availability could exacerbate the situation. The need for large-scale vaccination campaigns is critical to prevent further spread, but logistical challenges, such as reaching rural or remote areas (e.g., Naryn, Talas, and Batken provinces), complicate immunization efforts. There may also be a backlog in vaccination schedules or programs, as health facilities divert resources toward handling the current outbreak. The government and international organizations may need to allocate additional funding to support response. Other routine healthcare services such as maternal and child health, chronic disease management, and non-urgent medical procedures may be delayed or diverted to manage the outbreak, leading to disruptions in regular healthcare delivery. Potential Spread to Vulnerable Populations: The spread of measles, particularly in densely populated areas like Bishkek (2,098 cases), could disproportionately affect vulnerable populations such as children, the elderly, and those with weakened immune systems. Public health services may be strained by the dual burden of controlling the outbreak while maintaining regular healthcare services for these groups. Economic Impact: Health-related costs such as medical treatments, vaccines, and hospitalization will create economic burdens on families, communities, and the national health system. For affected families, particularly in rural areas, the financial impact can also extend to lost wages and costs for transportation to treatment centers. The outbreak could lead to stigma and fear surrounding measles cases, especially if the deaths of children increase public concern. Schools and other community spaces may close or implement restrictions to limit exposure, leading to social disruptions and a potential loss of educational opportunities for children. Families affected by measles could experience emotional distress, particularly those who lost children to the disease. Primary Effects on the Affected Population: Health Complications: Measles can cause severe complications, including pneumonia, encephalitis, and even death, especially in children and unvaccinated individuals. The vulnerable population, including those who are malnourished or immunocompromised, is at a heightened risk of severe outcomes. In remote or rural regions (e.g., Naryn, Talas, Batken provinces), access to healthcare services may be limited, either due to geographic barriers or the overwhelming demand on local healthcare infrastructure. These areas may face difficulties in receiving timely medical attention, diagnostic services, or vaccinations.

field_reports.description:
According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, an earthquake with a magnitude of 5 MSK-64 occurred on March 12 at 09:11 a.m. The epicenter was located 3 km north of Osh city. The intensity of the tremors reached 5 points in Osh city, as well as in the villages of Tashtak, Nariman, and Kyrgyz-Chek, and 4 points in Kara-Suu city.

Following an assessment by the Ministry of Emergency Situations, it was determined that 12 schools, 1 kindergarten, 1 FMC, 12 houses, and 26 other buildings were affected

The RCSK is monitoring the situation and is ready to provide assistance if requested.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Earthquake - 03-2025 - Earthquake in Osh oblast

results.name: KGZ: Earthquake - 03-2025 - Earthquake in Osh oblast

field_reports.description: According to the latest data from the Ministry of Emergency Situations as of July 17, 901 houses were affected by the floods to varying degrees and 599 people were evacuated. The evacuated individuals are living in temporary accommodation centers, in tents, or with their relatives. The assessment is still ongoing, and exact figures will be provided later.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 07-2024 - Floods in Osh region #10 (2024-07-17)

field_reports.description: According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, as of 5:00 PM on July 16, 796 (4,765 families) houses were affected by the floods and 589 people were evacuated. The evacuated individuals are living in temporary accommodation centers, in tents, or with their relatives. Additionally, 9 power stations and 6 bridges were partially or completely damaged. In the central bazaar of Osh city, 785 trade outlets were damaged. Unfortunately, 5 people were killed, and the search for 1 person is ongoing. The assessment is still ongoing, and exact data will be provided later.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 07-2024 - Floods in Osh region #9 (2024-07-17)
KGZ: Flood - 07-2024 - Floods in Osh region #8 (2024-07-16)

field_reports.description: A state of emergency has been declared in Osh oblast. On July 14, at about 14:00 local time, heavy rains triggered mudflows in the villages of Toloykon and in the recreation center "Borubai-Ata" in the village of Ozgur. Additionally, in the city of Osh, the Ak-Buura River overflowed its banks, flooding city streets and the central market. The city infrastructure, public facilities, electric substations, electric poles, and clean water pumping stations were significantly affected. According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, a total of 134 houses were affected. About 450 people were evacuated to safety from the Borubai-Ata recreation center and the village of Toloykon. One child died in the floods and three people were reported missing.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 07-2024 - Floods in Osh region #7 (2024-07-15)

field_reports.description: A state of emergency is declared in Batken district. July 10, at about 15:30 local time, heavy rains triggered mudflows in Ak-Tatyr village of Batken district. According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, 32 houses were damaged to varying degrees, along with more than 60 household plots and agriculture field. On the evening of July 10, 138 people were evacuated from affected area to neighboring villages to their relatives. The village infrastructure was also significantly damaged
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 07-2024 - Floods in Batken region #6 (2024-07-11)

field_reports.description: On June 28, between 16:00 and 16:30, heavy rains in the mountainous area triggered floods in three villages of Nookat district in the Osh region. The floods caused significant damage to village infrastructure and affected 128 households. Tragically, 8 people lost their lives as a result of the mudflows. According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, many residents were in the Apshyr-Sai recreation area during the floods, and the only road leading to the recreation area was completely destroyed due to the flooding. More than 1400 people have been evacuated.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 06-2024 - Floods in Osh region #5 (2024-07-01)

field_reports.description: On June 28, between 16:00 and 16:30, heavy rains in the mountainous area triggered floods in three villages of Nookat district in the Osh region. The floods caused significant damage to village infrastructure and affected 23 households. Tragically, 5 children lost their lives as a result of the mudflows.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 06-2024 - Floods in Osh #4 (2024-06-29)

field_reports.description:
From June 21 to June 24, mudflows in several regions of Kyrgyzstan were triggered by heavy rains in mountainous areas.

On June 21 at 21:30, in four villages of the Jalal-Abad region, 356 households were affected by mudflows. Additionally, one private factory and one bridge were affected.

On June 22 at 15:40, in the village of Toktoyan in the Tyup district of the Issyk-Kul region, 11 residential houses were flooded. Water flooded the yards of eight houses and got inside parts of three houses. A total of 91 people, including local residents and Ministry of Emergency Situations personnel, participated in the cleanup efforts.

On June 22 at 17:00, mudflows descended in four villages of the Uzgen district of the Osh region, affecting 79 houses. A total of 48 people from the Ministry of Emergency Situations and local residents, along with two special vehicles, were involved in the cleanup operations.

On June 22 at about 19:00, the road between Myrza-Ake and Kara-Shoro in the Osh region was blocked by mudflows at the 47-50 km mark. The Ministry of Emergency Situations and civil protection services cleared the road.

On 23-24 June 2024, as a result of heavy rains in mountainous areas, mudflows occurred in the Batken, Talas and Jalal-Abad regions which affected more than 500 families. At the moment the Ministry of Emergency Situations has declared a state of emergency in 5 locations of Batken region. Additionally, in the village of Halmion, there is currently no access to drinking water. According to the MoeS, one person, aged 5, died as a result of the mudflows
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 06-2024 - Floods in Kyrgyzstan #3 (2024-06-26)

field_reports.description:
In the first two days, the Ministry of Emergency Situations cleared over 100 households affected by the mudflows, reaching 90% completion. Additionally, 34 houses, 20 basements, and 24 barns that were flooded have been cleared.

The Jalal-Abad branch of the RCSK distributed hygiene kits, kitchen sets, and mattresses to 13 of the most vulnerable families (Lonely elderly people, families with disabled members, single headed households, and household with multi-child family).
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 06-2024 - Floods in Jalal Abad region #2 (2024-06-19)

field_reports.description:
On June 17, at about 18:30 local time, in the villages of Boston and Eski Kochkor-Ata in the Nooken district of the Jalal-Abad region, mudflows descended due to short-term rains. Additionally, 900 meters of the Osh-Bishkek Road were damaged by the mudflows and are currently closed. According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, one person died as a result of the debris flows.

At the moment, the Ministry of Emergency Situations has deployed about 300 people and more than 40 pieces of special equipment to eliminate the consequences of the debris flows. The Ministry is also currently assessing the damage.

Additionally, employees of the Jalal-Abad regional branch of the RCSK are assessing the damage.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 06-2024 - Floods in Jalal Abad region

results.name: KGZ: Flood - 06-2024 - Floods in Jalal Abad region

field_reports.description:
Within the first 48 hours after the first floods the RCSK has deployed 20 NDRT members in Osh, Jalal-Abad, Batken and Talas provinces to conduct emergency needs assessment and distribute humanitarian aid to affected population.

 

RCRC Movement partners closely monitor the situation. IFRC is ready to support the RCSK with DREF request to support affected families and replenish non-food items in the RCSK stocks / warehouses. Swiss Red Cross supported the RCSK with the amount of KGS 100’000 to cover fuel expenses.

 

MES KR announces state of emergency in following provinces: Osh, Jalal-Abad, Batken and Talas.

MES KR together with local administrations activated available resources such as heavy machinery and labor power to clean mud in the above-mentioned provinces. MES KR deployed 685 personnel to respond to the disaster all over the country. More than 100 units of heavy machinery have been involved since the beginning of emergency.

field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 04-2024 - Floods in Osh, Jalalabad and Talas regions #2 (2024-04-25)

field_reports.description:
Jalal-Abad region

According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, on 22 April at 00:00, mudflows descended in Nooken district of Jalal-Abad region. According to preliminary data, more than 260 families were affected. In Nooken district, the villages of Eski Kochkor-Ata and Boston were affected by mudflows. As a result, according to preliminary data, 30 residential houses, 1 school and 1 km of the Bishkek-Osh Road were affected. 1,565 families from Boston village were displaced to avoid risks.


Talas region

According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations on 22 April in Akzhar village, Talas district, about 250 houses from Sheker, Kok-Sai, Bakai-Ata, Ak-Zhar, Kok-Kashat and Ak-Zhar villages of Aitmatovsky district and Talas district were affected by mudflows due to rains.

Osh region

According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, 11 villages were affected by mudflows in Osh region. As a result, 317 households, 5 public buildings were damaged and 2 people died.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 04-2024 - Floods in Osh, Jalalabad and Talas regions

results.name: KGZ: Flood - 04-2024 - Floods Kyrgyzstan
results.summary:
Jalal-Abad region

According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, on 22 April at 00:00, mudflows descended in Nooken district of Jalal-Abad region. According to preliminary data, more than 260 families were affected. In Nooken district, the villages of Eski Kochkor-Ata and Boston were affected by mudflows. As a result, according to preliminary data, 30 residential houses, 1 school and 1 km of the Bishkek-Osh Road were affected. 1,565 families from Boston village were displaced to avoid risks.


Talas region

According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations on 22 April in Akzhar village, Talas district, about 250 houses from Sheker, Kok-Sai, Bakai-Ata, Ak-Zhar, Kok-Kashat and Ak-Zhar villages of Aitmatovsky district and Talas district were affected by mudflows due to rains.

Osh region

According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, 11 villages were affected by mudflows in Osh region. As a result, 317 households, 5 public buildings were damaged and 2 people died.

field_reports.description:
On the night of January 23, 2023, at 00:09, a strong earthquake with a magnitude of 8 occurred. The epicenter of the earthquake was located on the border between Kyrgyzstan and China, near the Kyzylsu-Kyrgyz Autonomous Region.

In the Jeti-Oguz district of the Issyk-Kul region, the earthquake was felt with an intensity of 7 points. In the cities of Karakol and Kaji-Sai, its strength reached 4.5 points, in Naryn - 4 points, and in the Kyrgyzstan, Bishkek, - 3 points.

According to initial data from the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Kyrgyz Republic, there were no casualties or significant damages as a result of the earthquake.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Earthquake - 01-2024 - Earthquake in Kyrgyzstan 01/23/2024

results.name: KGZ: Earthquake - 01-2024 - Earthquake in Kyrgyzstan 01/23/2024
results.summary:
On the night of January 23, 2023, at 00:09, a strong earthquake with a magnitude of 8 occurred. The epicenter of the earthquake was located on the border between Kyrgyzstan and China, near the Kyzylsu-Kyrgyz Autonomous Region.

In the Jeti-Oguz district of the Issyk-Kul region, the earthquake was felt with an intensity of 7 points. In the cities of Karakol and Kaji-Sai, its strength reached 4.5 points, in Naryn - 4 points, and in the Kyrgyzstan, Bishkek, - 3 points.

According to initial data from the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Kyrgyz Republic, there were no casualties or significant damages as a result of the earthquake.

field_reports.epi_notes_since_last_fr: Since the beginning of 2023, 1,734 cases of measles have been registered in Kyrgyzstan.
field_reports.description:
Measles is dangerous with complications, inflammation of the lungs, brain, eyes, leading to blindness. 
The Ministry of Health of KR reports, 2 deaths from measles have been registered in Kyrgyzstan August 14, 2023. Lethal outcomes were recorded in Bishkek city (3-year-old child) and in Chui region (one-year-old child). In both cases, the children did not receive vaccinations according to the National vaccination calendar, the parents refused due to religious beliefs.
The Ministry of Health notes that refusals are registered among newborns whose parents refuse preventive vaccinations against viral hepatitis and tuberculosis.
“The current situation leads to the accumulation of a susceptible contingent, a decrease in population (collective) immunity and the creation of conditions for the circulation of dangerous vaccine-preventable infections,” the ministry said.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Epidemic - 2023-08 - Measles outbreak in Kyrgyzstan

results.name: KGZ: Epidemic - 2023-08 - Measles outbreak in Kyrgyzstan
results.summary:
Measles is dangerous with complications, inflammation of the lungs, brain, eyes, leading to blindness. 
The Ministry of Health of KR reports, 2 deaths from measles have been registered in Kyrgyzstan August 14, 2023. Lethal outcomes were recorded in Bishkek city (3-year-old child) and in Chui region (one-year-old child). In both cases, the children did not receive vaccinations according to the National vaccination calendar, the parents refused due to religious beliefs.
The Ministry of Health notes that refusals are registered among newborns whose parents refuse preventive vaccinations against viral hepatitis and tuberculosis.
“The current situation leads to the accumulation of a susceptible contingent, a decrease in population (collective) immunity and the creation of conditions for the circulation of dangerous vaccine-preventable infections,” the ministry said.

contacts.name: Seval Guzelkilinc
contacts.title: Head of Delegetaion (CCD for Central Asia)

field_reports.description:
According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations dated August 2, 2023,  about 18:30, short-term heavy rains in Ken-Suu and Uzun-Sai villages of the Tyup district, Issyk-Kul province caused mudflows that flooded houses, agriculture fields, roads and bridges. According to preliminary collected information from Ken-Suu, residents of the affected villages faced the following consequences:

 

-          31 households in Ken-Suu village were affected,

-          6  houses with flooded basements,

-          1 house destroyed walls

-          3 barns with destroyed walls.

-          24.5 hectares of arable land were flooded, out of which:

Wheat: 4.5 hectares

Barley: 16.5 hectares

Potatoes: 1.5 hectares

Clover: 2 hectares

 

In Baizak village:

-          12 houses were damaged by mudflows

-          2 of them with flooded basements.

 

In Balbay village

-           houses were damaged by mudflows

 

 

On August 3, 2023, the Ministry of Emergency Situations allocated the following equipment to respond to the consequences of the mudflows:

2 bulldozers

2 sewage collectors

2 loaders

1 grader

6 excavators

5 motor pumps

1 fire engine

 

Additionally, 72 rescuers from the Ministry of Emergency Situations, 40 people from the local community, and 5 RCSK volunteers arrived at the disaster area.

 

The Issyk-Kul regional branch of RCSK allocated 50,000 KGS from the emergency fund to cover fuel for response activities.

 

Also, according to preliminary information, on August 7, 2023, around 17:00 hours, mudflows occurred in the villages of Taldy-Suu, Korumdu, and the Karkyr community in the Tup district of the Issyk-Kul province due to heavy rains. MoES staff had conducted household survey and gathered data as follows:

 

-          28 houses including its basements, internal roads are flooded in In Taldy-Suu village.

-          40 houses including its basements, some houses itself and internal roads are flooded in Korumdu.

-          24 houses including its basements were flooded in Koochu village.

 

 

 

145 Households affected in total. State of Emergency was declared on 3rd August in Issyk-Kul province

 

Mudflows flooded agricultural fields in rural areas. After detailed assessment, specialists from the District Department of Agrarian Development will provide additional information on affected area indicating types of crops.

 

The MoES mobnilized 41 rescuers, 1excavator, 1 loader and 1 cargo dump truck, local authorities provided 1 grader, 3 excavators, 1 tractor.

 

In all affected villages people face difficulties with hygiene conditions and in some even with drinking water.

 

RCSK staff is on the spot of disaster and in close contact with affected communities and state structures. Due to big scale of disaster and limited resources the RCSK team is discussing possibility of allocating DREF funds.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 2023-08 - Mudflows Kyrgyzstan Issyk-Kul province

contacts.name: Seval Guzelkilinc
contacts.title: Head of Delegetaion (CCD for Central Asia)

field_reports.description:
On July 21, 2023, between 19:30 and 20:00, mudflows descended in the village of Kulanak, Naryn district, after heavy rains. As a result, 16 houses were flooded, with water entering and flooding 4 of them. According to the Naryn State Administration, 4 rescuers were dispatched to provide assistance. The rescuers pumped out the water and conducted cleaning operations. Additionally, the local authorities provided two loading machines to help with the cleanup of the affected houses.

RCSK volunteers, as members of the Local Disaster Management Team, assisted MES KR staff in pumping water into flooded houses, using previously provided equipment for disaster preparedness and response. RCSK Naryn Branch staff conducted a rapid assessment of the consequences of the floods. The assessment identified 16 affected households with 62 people living in them. 4 households were the most affected. The primary assessment revealed the need to provide cash assistance to the 4 most affected households to eliminate the consequences of flooding, as well as to purchase necessary construction materials for the reconstruction of houses.   

According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations of Kyrgyz Republic, on July 26 at 19:30, in the rural community of Soviet, in Kadamjai district of Batken province, there were mudflows caused by heavy rains. In Soviet rural community, 4 vehicles were carried away by the mudflows. In the villages of Kozhokorum and Shum (approximately 50 households), an internal farm road with a length of 2700 meters was destroyed. In the village of Kyrgyz-Kyshtak, the road leading to the pasture with a length of 6300 meters was also destroyed. In addition, roads belonging to the Production Linear Management of Automobile Roads No. 46 with a length of 580 meters were damaged. Sixteen electric poles were destroyed. Pipes with a length of 6400 meters and a reservoir that operated through drainage and provided clean water to Soviet village were also damaged. 150 gabions were completely destroyed. Presumably, 7 heads of large-horned cattle, 11 head of small-horned cattle, and 15 beekeeping farms were carried away by the mudflows.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Flood - 2023-07 - Mudflow Kyrgyzstan July

results.name: KGZ: Flood - 2023-08 - Mudflows Kyrgyzstan Issyk-Kul province
results.summary:
According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations dated August 2, 2023,  about 18:30, short-term heavy rains in Ken-Suu and Uzun-Sai villages of the Tyup district, Issyk-Kul province caused mudflows that flooded houses, agriculture fields, roads and bridges. According to preliminary collected information from Ken-Suu, residents of the affected villages faced the following consequences:
 
- 31 households in Ken-Suu village were affected,
- 6  houses with flooded basements,
- 1 house destroyed walls
- 3 barns with destroyed walls.
- 24.5 hectares of arable land were flooded, out of which:
Wheat: 4.5 hectares
Barley: 16.5 hectares
Potatoes: 1.5 hectares
Clover: 2 hectares
 
In Baizak village:
- 12 houses were damaged by mudflows
- 2 of them with flooded basements.
 
In Balbay village
- houses were damaged by mudflows
 
On August 3, 2023, the Ministry of Emergency Situations allocated the following equipment to respond to the consequences of the mudflows:
2 bulldozers
2 sewage collectors
2 loaders
1 grader
6 excavators
5 motor pumps
1 fire engine

Additionally, 72 rescuers from the Ministry of Emergency Situations, 40 people from the local community, and 5 RCSK volunteers arrived at the disaster area.
 
The Issyk-Kul regional branch of RCSK allocated 50,000 KGS from the emergency fund to cover fuel for response activities.
 
Also, according to preliminary information, on August 7, 2023, around 17:00 hours, mudflows occurred in the villages of Taldy-Suu, Korumdu, and the Karkyr community in the Tup district of the Issyk-Kul province due to heavy rains. MoES staff had conducted household survey and gathered data as follows:
 
- 28 houses including its basements, internal roads are flooded in In Taldy-Suu village.
- 40 houses including its basements, some houses itself and internal roads are flooded in Korumdu.
- 24 houses including its basements were flooded in Koochu village.

145 Households affected in total. State of Emergency was declared on 3rd August in Issyk-Kul province

Mudflows flooded agricultural fields in rural areas. After detailed assessment, specialists from the District Department of Agrarian Development will provide additional information on affected area indicating types of crops.

The MoES mobnilized 41 rescuers, 1excavator, 1 loader and 1 cargo dump truck, local authorities provided 1 grader, 3 excavators, 1 tractor.

In all affected villages people face difficulties with hygiene conditions and in some even with drinking water.

RCSK staff is on the spot of disaster and in close contact with affected communities and state structures. Due to big scale of disaster and limited resources the RCSK team is discussing possibility of allocating DREF funds.

field_reports.description:
As of 10:30, the situation in the Batken region is stable.

Transportation of temporarily displaced citizens to their places of residence has begun, this confirmed by Batken branch director.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Other - 2022-09 - Transborder conflict #2 (2022-09-15)

field_reports.description:
According to several news agencies and based on Batken branch field reports, on September 14, a 7-00 morning, in the Bulak-Bashi area of the Batken region, the border guards of Kyrgyzstan discovered a border detachment of Tajikistan. The military personnel of the neighboring country took up combat positions on an undescribed section of the state border. The demands of the Kyrgyz border guard to leave the territory were ignored. Tajik border guards opened fire. In response, the servicemen of the Kyrgyz Republic also used weapons. A shootout began, during which the Tajik side used mortars.

The situation on the Kyrgyz-Tajik section of the state border in the Bulak-Bashi area continues to be tense. This was reported by the Border Service of the State Committee for National Security of Kyrgyzstan.

It is clarified that at the moment the shootout has been stopped.

“Negotiations between the head of the regional department of the Border Service for the Batken region, Kyyalbek Tolonbaev, and his Tajik counterpart are ongoing,” the department reported near 12-00 am.

Starting from 14-00, Batken branch volunteers reported that in the area of Bulak bashi there was a shootout between the border guards of the two countries. There are reports of 2 wounded, military forces are being drawn to the place of conflict.

Volunteers reported that the shootout started at 14-20 in Dostuk village, Batken region. The evacuation began in the villages of Dostuk, Kok-Tash, and Ortoboz. Aksay and Samarkandek prepares for evacuation. 2 evacuation points prepared in Batken city.

By 15-00, we still receive information from volunteers that confirm that the fire shooting continues, and conflict started in the Teskei area as well.

RCSK Batken Branch is in close communication with key stakeholders and coordinating its activities with the Ministry of Emergency Situations, Batken Oblast Administration, and others.
field_reports.summary: KGZ: Other - 2022-09 - Transborder conflict

results.name: KGZ: Other - 2022-09 - Transborder conflict
results.summary:
According to several news agencies and based on Batken branch field reports, on September 14, a 7-00 morning, in the Bulak-Bashi area of the Batken region, the border guards of Kyrgyzstan discovered a border detachment of Tajikistan. The military personnel of the neighboring country took up combat positions on an undescribed section of the state border. The demands of the Kyrgyz border guard to leave the territory were ignored. Tajik border guards opened fire. In response, the servicemen of the Kyrgyz Republic also used weapons. A shootout began, during which the Tajik side used mortars.

The situation on the Kyrgyz-Tajik section of the state border in the Bulak-Bashi area continues to be tense. This was reported by the Border Service of the State Committee for National Security of Kyrgyzstan.

It is clarified that at the moment the shootout has been stopped.

“Negotiations between the head of the regional department of the Border Service for the Batken region, Kyyalbek Tolonbaev, and his Tajik counterpart are ongoing,” the department reported near 12-00 am.

Starting from 14-00, Batken branch volunteers reported that in the area of Bulak bashi there was a shootout between the border guards of the two countries. There are reports of 2 wounded, military forces are being drawn to the place of conflict.

Volunteers reported that the shootout started at 14-20 in Dostuk village, Batken region. The evacuation began in the villages of Dostuk, Kok-Tash, and Ortoboz. Aksay and Samarkandek prepares for evacuation. 2 evacuation points prepared in Batken city.

field_reports.description: As of 31 January, the situation in the Batken region is stable. This was confirmed by the Border Service of the State Committee for National Security of the Kyrgyz Republic. According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations (MoES) 689 people were evacuated during the conflict to Batken district. MoES provided them with 550 beddings. More than 20 000 to Leilek district (accurate number didn’t provide, by the previous report MoES informed that total number was 23 432) As of today all displaced people returned 1 RCSK assessment, RCSK Batken branch to their homes. According to the Ministry of Health of Kyrgyzstan, 13 were wounded (gunshots, shrapnel wounds from a mortar) as a result of the conflict at the border. All of them are military personnel. Among the evacuees, 5 were hospitalized with different health problems. Batken district electricity campaign fully restored the electricity power supply in the area.
field_reports.summary: RCSK Situation report #3 (final) Kyrgyzstan-Tajikstan border conflict as of 31 January

field_reports.description:
According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations (MoES) 24 232 people were evacuated 
during last night to Leilek and Batken districts. Moved part of the displaced people are located in Temporary centres (mosques, schools and kinder gardens) 
As of 13:00, the situation in the Batken region is stable. This was confirmed by the Ministry 
of Emergency Situations of the Kyrgyz Republic. In the area of Tort-Kocho, joint patrols from 
Kyrgyz and Tajik border guards are being conducted, law enforcement officers are present. Road is open. All power lines have been restored in Batken, residents' houses have been provided with electricity, According to the Ministry of Health of Kyrgyzstan, 11 people have been injured as a result of the conflict at the border. All of them are military personnel.
field_reports.summary: RCSK Situation report #2 Kyrgyzstan-Tajikstan border conflict as of 28 January 2022

field_reports.description:
According to several news agencies on January 27, at 18.15 Tajik border guards 
blocked a section of the Batken-Isfana road in the Tort-Kocho area of the Batken region. The 
situation on the Kyrgyz-Tajik part of the state border is characterized as tense. Following the results of negotiations between the border representatives of both countries, 
the section of the Batken-Isfana road in the area of Tort-Kocho was reopened for travel at 19.30. 
A few minutes later, the situation worsened - the Tajik side used weapons and opened fire on the 
border units of the Kyrgyz Republic in the Chir-Dobo area of the Batken region, reported by the 
Border Service of the State Committee for National Security of the Kyrgyz Republic. Zubaydullo 
Shomadov, the spokesman for the Mayor's Office of Isfara (Tajikstan), informed that the incident 
arose due to the fact that stones were thrown at the cars of citizens of Tajikistan. 
At 21.45, by the initiative of Tajikistan, negotiations on a ceasefire were held between the 
director of the Border Service of the State Committee for National Security Ularbek Sharsheev 
and the commander of the Border Troops of the State Committee for National Security of 
Tajikistan Rajabali Rahmonali. 
At 22.30, the servicemen of the Republic of Tajikistan continued firing. The Border 
Service of the State Committee for National Security of Kyrgyzstan stated that the actions of the 
military of Tajikistan on the spot was coordinated, which confirms the advance preparation of a 
provocation, says information on Mass Media. 
Later on, information on the usage of mortars by Tajikistan not of the border troops, but of the 
Armed Forces, which is a gross violation of international and bilateral agreements between the 
countries. 
Several villages in the Batken region were left without electricity. Local residents were 
evacuated from the site of the escalation of the conflict. 
At 02.29 (28/01/22) there was information that the fire had ceased in two villages of 
Kyrgyzstan - Kocho-Boyu and Dakhma, while shooting is still being carried out in the areas of 
Golovnoy and Tort-Kocho. 
According to the Ministry of Health of Kyrgyzstan, seven people have been injured as a 
result of the conflict at the border. All of them are military personnel.
field_reports.summary: RCSK Situation report #1 Kyrgyzstan-Tajikstan border conflict as of 27 January 2022

results.name: RCSK Situation report #1 Kyrgyzstan-Tajikstan border conflict as of 27 January 2022

contacts.name: Seval Guzelkilinc
contacts.title: Head of CA IFRC regional office

field_reports.description:
On 19 July mudflows occurred in the Leilek district of Batken province.  On 10 July mudflows occurred in the Suzak district of Jajal - Abad province. According to preliminary
data provided by the regional office of the Ministry of Emergency Situations, more than 592
households were affected.
field_reports.summary: Situation report #2 on mudflows in Jalal-Abad and Batken province

contacts.name: Seval Guzelkilinc
contacts.title: Head of CA IFRC regional office

field_reports.description:
On 19 July mudflows occurred in the Leilek district of Batken province. According to preliminary
data provided by the regional office of the Ministry of Emergency Situations, more than 80
households and 6,000 square kilometres of cultivated land were affected.

According to preliminary data, in the area of Kara-Darya at about 17:00 after a torrential rain on
20 July, a mudflow came down from the mountain hollows. 446 yards of residential houses were
flooded in the villages of Dostuk (56 households were affected; 12 of them were flooded, 2 were
destroyed) and Changyr-Tash (390 households were affected; 106 of them were flooded, 21 were
destroyed) of the Suzak Uzak district. In addition, the Suzak - Kara-Darya road was flooded. As
a result of the natural disaster, M.A., born in 2015, died. The girl's body was found at about
22:50 on 20 July
field_reports.summary: Mudflows in Jalal-Abad and Batken provinces

results.name: Mudflows in Jalal-Abad and Batken provinces

contacts.name: Seval Guzelkilinc
contacts.title: Head of CA IFRC regional office

field_reports.description: According to the press service of the Ministry of Emergency Situations  on July 12, between 18:00 and 19:00 mudflows descended from the mountain valleys in Jany-Zhol and Ak-Zhol villages, Aksy district of Jalal-Abad province, after heavy rains. As a result of the mudflow 6 people died, 2 are missing. The backyards of 20 houses were flooded. The bodies of six people (two men and four women) were found during search operations. The search operations are continuing.
field_reports.summary: Kyrgyzstan, mudflows in Jalal-Abad province 13 July 2021

results.name: Kyrgyzstan, mudflows in Jalal-Abad province 13 July 2021

field_reports.description:
The water level in the “Talas” river is above the normal level;
In the village of Tuito, on the border of Talas and Bakai-Ata districts, ditches and channels
flooded the yards of 46 houses;
1 medical centre was flooded;
43,3 hectares of arable land were flooded;
Aqueduct "Kalinin" was washed away by floodwaters. Mechanical cleaning of 2 km of Kalinin
channel, backfilling with sand and gravel is required.
Commission of Civil Protection, 1 loader from village administration, 1 excavator, 2 tractors, 50 people,
including staff of the district MES KR - 15 people, members of local disaster management committees of
RCSK - 10 people are involved in the reconstruction works.
According to the news portal www.turmush.kg citizens whose houses are insured will receive
compensation. The immediate restoration of channels is currently under consideration since there is
not enough irrigation water for 5,400 hectares of crops. Farmers are again working on ploughing the
arable land.
In connection with the natural disaster, the issue of allocation of funds from the national budget for
strengthening and restoration of channels will be raised, and prompt solutions will be proposed.
field_reports.summary: Floods in Talas province

field_reports.description: Based on the information provided by the Ministry of Health of KR on 30 April at 7:50 am, 13 citizens of Kyrgyzstan died and 134 people were injured. 25 casualties have been transported from Batken province to Bishkek by a special flight. The condition of 2 of the injured people was assessed as serious, while the others were moderately serious and relatively satisfactory. The Foreign Ministers of the two countries during the negotiations reached an agreement on a complete ceasefire from 8 p.m. on April 29 and the withdrawal of military forces to their former places of deployment. As further steps, the sides agreed to strengthen joint information and awareness-raising work with the population at the level of local authorities (regional, district and village levels) of the two countries with the participation of the territorial subdivisions of the border services; to organize joint groups of law enforcement bodies at the regional level to monitor and patrol the situation in the border area; to maintain constant direct communication between the foreign ministries and personally between the ministers for a rapid solution of the problem. The foreign ministers called on both sides not to give in to provocations of certain destructive forces.
field_reports.summary: Kyrgyzstan-Tajikistan border conflict (update: 30 April 2021)

field_reports.description: According to the RCSK Batken branchDirector, Zhigitov Kanatbek, the evacuation of women, children and the elderly to the organized temporary settlements in fourschools in Batken citybegan at 7 a.m.The Batken branch staff conducted a needs assessment of the places where people were accommodated. At the moment 631people have been accommodated in fourschools, 409of whom are children.193 people were placed in the Kyzyl Jol neighborhood and 18 people stayed with their relatives in Batken city.Among the displaced there areinfants andpregnant women. From early morning, drinking water, breakfasts, psycho-social kits and diapers for infants were provided byRCSK Batken branch.Volunteers are providingpsychological first aidto children, using PSS kits. Two passenger cars were sent to Kok-Tashvillage to evacuate the population.Part of Batken team wentto the site of the conflict for a detailed assessmentand provided first aid to affected people.
field_reports.summary: Kyrgyzstan-Tajikistan border conflict (update: 28 April 2021)

field_reports.description:
Public protests are continuing in Bishkek caused by the results of the Parliamentary elections, which took place on 4 October. On October 14, more than a thousand people have gathered on the Old Square. The protesters came from different regions of Kyrgyzstan. They demand to speed up the procedure for appointing their leader as the Prime Minister. During the extraordinary session on October 14, the deputies of the Jogorku Kenesh reсonsidered the candidacy of for the post of Prime Minister and Speaker of Parliament, in accordance with the presidential decree. Parliament approved the composition and program of the government. 
Based on the report of press service of the Internal Affairs Department, the night of October 14 passed calmly and without incidents in Bishkek. On October 15, Kyrgyzstan President said he has decided to resign. Parliament Speaker refused to perform his duties as president, which he should take under the Constitution. This means that the authority of the President and the Prime Minister will be transferred to the new Prime Minister. However, the State of Emergency in Bishkek will be in force until October 19 and it is prohibited to leave key leaders positions of the country (Constitution of Kyrgyzstan, article 23).
field_reports.summary: Protest of party representatives dissatisfied with the results of the parliamentary elections

field_reports.description: On Sunday, October 4, parliamentary elections were held in Kyrgyzstan. Multiple opposition groups have publicly contested the results of the country's parliamentary election on Sunday, October 4, with only four of 16 registered parties having passed the seven percent vote-share threshold in order to gain seats in the legislature. From October 5 to October 9, representatives of parties who failed to secure seats in parliament at the recent elections organized mass unrest in Bishkek city, stormed buildings of state institutions. Over 1200 people have been injured and one person has been killed in mass protests following the election results, which included the seizure of a number of government buildings by various opposition factions. Police have used water cannon, stun grenades, and tear gas to disperse crowds. On Tuesday, October 6, the election commission subsequently annulled the results of the poll and Prime Minister resigned, but this has failed to placate opposition groups On October 9 the decree about introduction of emergency regime in Bishkek was signed by President because of difficult social and political situation. According to the order of commandant, there is a curfew in the capital from 21:00 to 5:00. The Jogorku Kenesh has not yet approved or rejected the presidential decree. However, according to the press service of the head of state, the parliament must consider the document within three days, and before that, the decree is considered to have entered into force. On October 12, the situation in Bishkek is calm; the night of October 12 passed quietly, the press service of the Main Department of Internal Affairs of the capital reported. It is noted that the city is under the protection of the armed forces, law enforcement agencies and people's squads, which provide public security and protection of order around the clock. Since 05:00, traffic and citizens are moving in a normal mode, said the Main Department of Internal Affairs. All business objects and organizations of state institutions continue to function. No facts of destabilization of the situation and possible manifestations of provocations have been registered and revealed, added in the department
field_reports.summary: Protest of party representatives dissatisfied with the results of the parliamentary elections

field_reports.description: On Sunday, October 4, parliamentary elections were held in Kyrgyzstan. On October 5, demonstrations began in Bishkek that led to mass riots and partial seizure of power. By the morning of October 9, the situation partially stabilized but the threat of escalation of tension remains evident. The banks partially resumed their work. From October 5 till October 7 according to the decision of the National Bank practically all financial operations including international ones were suspended. Bishkek supermarkets decided not to sell alcoholic drinks in the evenings. Customers can buy alcohol only until 18.00. On October 8, during the day it was quiet in Bishkek. Vigilantes were patrolling the city. No reports of clashes or attempted robberies were received. Vigilantes’ groups came on duty on the night of October 8-9. They dispersed throughout the city and patrolled crossroads and protected commercial and state objects. In Osh city, the protesters are stopped. The city is under police control. Most yurts in the main square of the southern capital have already been dismantled. Today, October 9, two peace rallies are scheduled for this afternoon. This was announced by a member of one political party.
field_reports.summary: Protest of party representatives dissatisfied with the results of the parliamentary elections

field_reports.description: On October 4, the Kyrgyzstan held parliamentary elections which has created dissatisfaction among population and some parties who have been dissented with results of the elections of deputies in the Jogorku Kenesh. Following Parliamentary elections on 4 October, large numbers of protesters have gathered in central Bishkek and other cities across the country. It is likely that these demonstrations will continue on subsequent days, and some may become violent. In some cases, protesters have clashed with the police and tear gas and rubber bullets have been used
field_reports.summary: Protest of party representatives dissatisfied with the results of the parliamentary elections

field_reports.description: On October 4, the Kyrgyzstan held parliamentary elections which has created dissatisfaction among some parties who have been dissented with results of the elections of deputies in the Jogorku Kenesh. On October 5, representatives of political parties, civic activists and citizens started as a peaceful demonstration on the Central Square in Bishkek that turned into unrest with followed clashes between protesting civilians and governmental forces. The clashes stopped with a full surrender of law reinforcement and released of the ex-president, ex-prime ministers and several prisoners. Below the information on October 6: - During the day, the protests were continuing to held over the country. Governors and mayors had resigned in some provinces of central cities in Kyrgyzstan. - Deputies of Jogorku Kenesh approved a new candidacy of the Prime Minister; - Coordination Council for settling the situation in Bishkek was formed. There have been attempts to take over strategic state and commercial buildings in Bishkek. Group of vigilantes and activists were organized in Bishkek city, and they protected the streets, citizens and buildings that were not affected with their help and support; - Now the situation in Bishkek city and overall in the country is stable and RCSK is continuing to monitoring the situation.
field_reports.summary: Protest of party representatives dissatisfied with the results of the parliamentary elections

field_reports.description: On October 5, after the results of parliamentary elections, a number of parties made a statement that they did not recognize the results of elections. According to preliminary results of voting, 4 parties pass to parliament. The participants expressed their dissatisfaction with the results of elections of deputies to the Jogorku Kenesh. Participants in the protests were representatives of political parties, civic activists and citizens. The assembled political parties adopted a resolution, as informed member of one of the parties. Around 20:00 same evening, according to the RCSK national disaster response team report, peaceful protest turned into rally with followed clashes between protesting civilians and governmental forces. According to the mass media the unrest continued until aprox. 4 am in the morning the clashes stopped with full surrender of law reinforcement and release of ex-president, ex-prime ministers and several political prisoners1 . Below the information after 20:00: According to mass-media sources 590 civilians have suffered, 439 people after delivering medical support have been sent home, 150 people are currently in hospitals, 13 of them are in reanimation and there is 1 lethal case Now the situation in Bishkek city is stable, RCSK is monitoring the situation. In addition, according to the monitoring of the RCSK Branches, on October 6, 2020: - Talas region: around 300 protestors are captured the municipal administration and District Department on Internal Affairs without use of force. - Osh city: around 1500 protestors held a peaceful rally. - Naryn city: approximately 1000 demonstrators are in the city and authorized representative has retired. - Karakol city: 200 people gathered for a meeting, they captured the municipal administration, the governor is handed over his mandate. - Jalal-Abad: 200 protestors gathered for a meeting near to the municipal administration and 200 demonstrators are near to the city hall. - Kyzyl-Kia, Batken region: protesters are captured the city hall and the mayor of the city had to stand down after the meeting. - Chui region: protests are not observed yet. - Batken city: approximately 100 people gathering near to the municipal administration.
field_reports.summary: Protest of party representatives dissatisfied with the results of the parliamentary elections

results.name: Kyrgyzstan: Protests related to parliamentary elections
